categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Medications coded with RxNorm SCD, SBD, GPCK, or BPCPK codes
categoryRubrics.description: C-CDA medication lists should contain medications coded as RxNorm Semantic Clinical Drugs, Semantic Branded Drugs, and packs. This means prescribable products on the level of 'loratadine 10mg oral tablet'.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

issuesList.xmlString: #nomeds
medication:IBUPROFEN (Motrin) 200 MG TABS|dose:MG mg|route:ORAL|frequency:EVERY 4-6 HOURS OR AS NECESSARY 1044 WEST WALNUT RM 202 INDIANAPOLIS IN 17102 MEDHOST USER1

categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: Each medication needs to have its own Medication Signture Text EntryRelationship and the reference should exist in the same section where you found it

issuesList.xmlString: #nomeds
medication:IBUPROFEN (Motrin) 200 MG TABS|dose:MG mg|route:ORAL|frequency:EVERY 4-6 HOURS OR AS NECESSARY 1044 WEST WALNUT RM 202 INDIANAPOLIS IN 17102 MEDHOST USER1

categoryRubrics.description: Each medication needs to have its own Medication Signture Text EntryRelationship and the reference should exist in the same section where you found it

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value

referenceErrors.description: A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Family History Observation (V3) 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.46:2015-08-01. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension.
